intro: Noccidium tuberculatum, commonly known as the rough-leaved noccidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant has ovate to elliptic leaves with a rough, textured surface, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Noccidium tuberculatum is valued in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
